attributes.action: make further changes to the benefit system so that contributions to the system equate to benefit credits. Therefore, if a person doesn't contribute they don’t get any benefit.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I welcome the current proposed changes to the benefit system to make claimants work for their hand out, however I feel the changes don’t go far enough. I would like to propose that every citizen is entitled to an initial 6 months worth of benefits to be claimed at any point in their working life and payment of said benefit would be immediate without question or doubt. 

Once the initial 6 months “free” credit is consumed further benefit credits will need to be earned via gainful employment and contributions to the system. For instance, for every year worked where contributions to the system were made a person would earn 1 months worth of benefit credit so, work for 10 years and expect to get 10 months benefit paid immediately no questions asked.

The fundamental principle behind this is everyone gets a start of 6 months free, thereafter if people can’t find enough self motivation to feed and cloth themselves then why should hard working tax payers subsidise them?
